California ethnic studies classes are sparking controversy as mandate looms

A new state law will require all high school students to take a semester-long ethnic studies course to graduate, starting with the class of 2030. But recent controversy in San Mateo over the purpose of ethnic studies and how to teach it is likely just a preview of battles to come across the Bay Area and the state.
